title: KINEEMA / REPORTING THE CORPSE ON THE BOARDWALK
description: You report to the station that you have found a dead body from the boardwalk.

dialogueTree.title: Alice: ""One moment..." You can hear her sh..."
dialogueTree.text: "One moment..." You can hear her shuffling through some papers.

links.title: Alice: ""Can you please describe the body -..."
links.text: "Can you please describe the body -- age, sex, cause of death?"

links.title: You: ""An unidentified middle-aged man. H..."
links.text: "An unidentified middle-aged man. Height 170-175 cm, dark hair, medium build. Looks like he slipped, fell through a hole in the boardwalk and hit his head against the metal bench."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We suspect he might have been ineb..."
links.text: "We suspect he might have been inebriated when he fell -- there were bottles all around him, and traces of vomit on his shirt."

links.title: Alice: ""Any signs of violence?""
links.text: "Any signs of violence?"

links.title: You: ""No, seems like it was an accident.""
links.text: "No, seems like it was an accident."

links.title: Alice: ""No field autopsy necessary..." she..."
links.text: "No field autopsy necessary..." she repeats.

links.title: Perception (Hearing): "You can hear her quickly typing in..."
links.text: You can hear her quickly typing in the background.

links.title: Alice: ""What about his belongings? Did you..."
links.text: "What about his belongings? Did you examine his clothes?"

links.title: You: ""He was wearing boots, trousers and..."
links.text: "He was wearing boots, trousers and an old leather jacket with a bright blue lining. I found a library card from his pockets."

links.title: Alice: ""Any information on the library car..."
links.text: "Any information on the library card?"

links.title: You: ""It's from Central Jamrock Public L..."
links.text: "It's from Central Jamrock Public Library. It belongs to someone named Billie MÃ©jean."

links.title: Alice: ""Good, you have a lead.""
links.text: "Good, you have a lead."

links.title: Alice: ""Do you and Lieutenant Kitsuragi wa..."
links.text: "Do you and Lieutenant Kitsuragi want to take the case or should I assign it to someone else?"

links.title: You: ""We're taking the case.""
links.text: "We're taking the case."

links.title: Alice: ""I have assigned the case to Lieute..."
links.text: "I have assigned the case to Lieutenant Kim Kitsuragi. Please follow up on this library lead to identify the man. We'll send someone to take the body to the morgue."

links.title: Alice: ""That's all for now. Thank you for..."
links.text: "That's all for now. Thank you for reporting in. Is there anything else I can do for you?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Assign it to someone else, Alice -..."
links.text: "Assign it to someone else, Alice -- we've got enough on our plate."

links.title: Alice: ""Great, I'll give it to your collea..."
links.text: "Great, I'll give it to your colleagues. You don't have to worry about the case anymore, we'll send our officers to take away the body."

links.title: Alice: ""That's all for now. Thank you for..."
links.text: "That's all for now. Thank you for reporting in. Is there anything else I can do for you?"

links.title: You: ""Please assign it to someone else.""
links.text: "Please assign it to someone else."

links.title: You: ""I haven't examined it yet.""
links.text: "I haven't examined it yet."

links.title: Alice: "You can hear her sigh audibly on th..."
links.text: You can hear her sigh audibly on the other side.

links.title: Authority: "So unprofessional of you... Pity!"
links.text: So unprofessional of you... Pity!

links.title: You: ""Someone might have... pushed him?""
links.text: "Someone might have... pushed him?"

links.title: Alice: ""Did you perform a field autopsy?""
links.text: "Did you perform a field autopsy?"

links.title: You: ""No, it's still just a theory.""
links.text: "No, it's still just a theory."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It looked like an accident to me,..."
links.text: "It looked like an accident to me, Alice," the lieutenant rushes in to say. "But that's for the guys in processing to confirm."

links.title: You: ""There might be a *sequence killer*..."
links.text: "There might be a *sequence killer* on the loose."

links.title: Alice: ""A sequence killer." You can hear h..."
links.text: "A sequence killer." You can hear her stop typing. "Are you suggesting that this might be connected to the case you're working on?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No, we're not," the lieutenant rus..."
links.text: "No, we're not," the lieutenant rushes in to say. "There is no evidence to suggest that this man was connected to the lynching -- or that we're dealing with a sequence killer here."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It looked like a simple accident t..."
links.text: "It looked like a simple accident to me, Alice. No field autopsy necessary."

links.title: You: ""Yes.""
links.text: "Yes."

links.title: Alice: ""I see." Silence. "This is somethin..."
links.text: "I see." Silence. "This is something you should discuss with the Lieutenant Kitsuragi, as you're sharing the case."

links.title: You: ""No.""
links.text: "No."

links.title: Alice: ""No? It's some *other* sequence kil..."
links.text: "No? It's some *other* sequence killer?" Silence. "I see."

links.title: Alice: ""What about his belongings? Did you..."
links.text: "What about his belongings? Did you examine his clothes?" She goes on as if nothing happened.

links.title: You: ""Actually, scratch that -- there is..."
links.text: "Actually, scratch that -- there is no sequence killer, I just made it up."

links.title: Alice: ""You just made it up?" Silence. "I..."
links.text: "You just made it up?" Silence. "I see."

links.title: You: ""An unidentified middle-aged man. L..."
links.text: "An unidentified middle-aged man. Looks like he slipped, fell through a hole in the boardwalk and hit his head against the metal bench."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""The man was about 173 cm tall, sto..."
links.text: "The man was about 173 cm tall, stout, with dark hair and a moustache. We suspect he might have been inebriated when he slipped -- there were bottles all around him, and traces of vomit on his shirt."
